sentences.en: He solved the problem very practically.
sentences.cn: 他很实事求是地解决了这个问题.

sentences.en: He'd known the old man practically all his life.
sentences.cn: 他几乎从小就认识那位老人。

sentences.en: I step on the scales practically every morning.
sentences.cn: 我几乎每天早上都称一下体重。

sentences.en: I think racism is unconsciously inherent in practically everyone.
sentences.cn: 我认为种族偏见固有地存在于几乎所有人的潜意识中。

sentences.en: I’ve read practically all of his books.
sentences.cn: 我差不多读过他所有的书。

sentences.en: It was very neat, and practically bloodless.
sentences.cn: 这个手术干净利落, 基本上没流血.

sentences.en: It’s practically impossible to predict what will happen.
sentences.cn: 将会发生什么，几乎不能预料。

sentences.en: Italy had thus practically declared her independence.
sentences.cn: 意大利几乎就是这样宣告独立了.

sentences.en: My knowledge of the subject is practically nil.
sentences.cn: 我在这方面的知识几乎等于零.

sentences.en: She sees him practically every day.
sentences.cn: 她几乎天天见到他。

sentences.en: She's practically always late for school.
sentences.cn: 她上学几乎总是迟到.

sentences.en: The Chinese Christians, therefore, practically excommunicate themselves from their own clan.
sentences.cn: 所以, 中国的基督徒简直是被逐出了自己的家族了.

sentences.en: The condition is practically unknown outside psychiatry clinics.
sentences.cn: 除了医院的精神病科外，这种病几乎不为人知。

sentences.en: The course is more practically based than the Masters degree.
sentences.cn: 该课程比硕士学位课程更注重实践。

sentences.en: The theatre was practically empty.
sentences.cn: 剧院几乎是空的。

sentences.en: The two designs were practically identical.
sentences.cn: 这两个设计几乎一模一样。

sentences.en: There is practically no difference.
sentences.cn: 实际上并无差别.

sentences.en: These chemicals are practically insoluble in water.
sentences.cn: 这些化学物质几乎不溶于水.

sentences.en: We all knew by then that the affair was practically over.
sentences.cn: 到那时，我们都知道事情实际上已经结束了。

sentences.en: What I said made practically no impression on him.
sentences.cn: 我的话对他简直不起作用.

words.tran_cn: 可用的；行得通的；可实行的
实用性，实际性；实际，实例
